physical_appearance:This is an unfinished kebaya. It has yellow lilies embroided at the end of the sleeves. The kebaya has an elongated tapered end.
subject_terms_1:folk costume flowers (motifs) Peranakan unfinished embroidery (visual works) tops (garments
 general) blouses (main garments)
subject_terms_2:Ethnic costume Motifs Peranakan (Asian people) Embroidery Blouses
subject_terms_3:Peranakan costumes
sgcool_label_text:This kebaya has been cut from its fabric but remains unfinished. Yellow lilies are embroidered on the end of sleeves and bottom left portion of the kebaya while drawings in black give a glimpse of the intended design. Kebayas with elongated tapered ends were popular in the 1930s and many were commissioned by Peranakan women. It is part of a donation which contains a mixture of garments worn by Peranakan men and women.
